dicas_para_desenvolvedores.frase: Data dominates. If you've chosen the right data structures and organized things well, the algorithms will almost always be self-evident. Data structures, not algorithms, are central to programming
Write code as if the person maintaining it is a homicidal maniac.
Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
Solve the problem, not the symptom.
Keep your code DRY, but your documentation WET (Write Everything Twice).
Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
Coding is today's language of creativity. All our children deserve a chance to become creators instead of consumers of computer science.
